description: To carry out tree surgery - Reduce height from 16.5m to circa 14m and reduce lateral RADIUS to 8m which would leave a lateral SPREAD of 16m leaving balanced crown to one Oak T31 within TPO 514
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: The Oak is situated within the rear garden of 143 The Greenway, it is a prominent tree and has a
The Oak tree does not appear to have been prune before and as a result has a natural crown
typical of this species. It appears to be in good health and has the potential for a long life. The
application has alleged damage linked to the Oak and is therefore recommending a crown
reduction. Their report mentions "The pattern of movement is entirely consistent with the seasonal,
cyclical influence of tree roots" however following clarification this is an observational comment and
currently no level or crack monitor has been supplied to support this statement, although I
understand that it is in progress. Without the evidence of seasonal movement there is no clear
evidence that the damage has been caused by the tree, furthermore this level of crown reduction
will create multiple pruning wounds throughout the canopy and could lead to decline.
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
